alert.note: Alert for Carver; Dakota; Hennepin; Scott (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 25 at 9:44AM CDT until May 28 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Savage affecting Dakota, Carver, Scott and Hennepin Counties. .Additional rainfall over locations already in flood stage will stagnate river level drops over the next few days. Locations not in flood stage will bump closer as rainfall accumulates. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Savage. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 702.0 feet, Barge loading stops at Port Cargill, and other flood prevention measures are begun. Water begins to impact Black Dog Road in Burnsville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 AM CDT Wednesday, the stage was 703.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 900 AM CDT Wednesday was 703.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Friday evening and continue falling to 698.4 feet next Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 702.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 703.4 feet on 06/29/2011. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
